result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Lamont Hudson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Darnell Lamont Hudson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF1089. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Shipman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety. th

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Witness on a stolen property call and unable to appear.  Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Kerri Cleghorn
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($300.00) LW

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson not in court, defendant in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  State Public Defender's office has not yet appointed counsel.  Court finds good CAUSE.  Case scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court in receipt of warrant regaridng this defendant. Court contacted parties via email to schedule a return on warrant hearing date. Return on warrant hearing scheduled for July 29th, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cermak Fresh Market or Co-actor: Hector F. Pintor

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darnell Lamont Hudson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Case retabbed to Branch 28 due to lower number case(s) pending. Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2 and 4.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
